description: Borrowed from Hindi कोस (kos), from Sanskrit क्रोश (króśa, “cry, yell; measure of distance”).

entries.meaning: (South Asia) A measure of distance, varying from one and a quarter to two and a half English miles.
examples: A full half koss from bank to bank is the stream now – you can see it under the stars – and there are ten feet of water therein.
